评论详情: I have bought this brand before in Petite Small, it always fit, so now I ordered 2 pair. What I received was over 2 inches too long and too wide. I dont usually return stuff, so Goodwill is the new owner of both pair. Quality: fabric is thinner and more rigid than previously, and there are some loose threads. My previously acquired pants had been just fine, no frills but comfortable and fairly durable enough that I was willing to order again. What arrived this time is not only higher price, but also lower quality, and too big for the size on the label. If you are in the 5'2" 110 lb range, you will swim inside Petite Small size.

评论概述: Fit not quite right, but may be an option if you're between 2 pants sizes and bottom heavy like me
评论详情: I normally wear Cherokee WW170 and 4200 scrubs in size petite small. Since I've gained weight, my old pants are now too tight in the hip & thigh area. The petite medium in both of those styles were entirely too big for me.  Enter WW210. I'm 4"11, 137lbs and carry most of my weight in my hip and thigh area (waist 28.7", hip 42", thigh 23" circumference). I initially ordered a size petite small, but couldn't get them over my thighs. Then I tried petite medium (pictured above) and they worked. These pants seem to have a more narrow cut in the posterior/upper thigh area, while still allowing for a roomy fit in the thigh area. You can see they are still somewhat loose in the waist. I remedied this by adding a drawstring.  I was worried about the pants being too thin, but "overexposure" wasn't a problem when I wore them--I guess since my butt & thighs don't radiate light. Actually, I appreciated the weight of the material since it helped me stay cool. All in all, this was a reasonable option for me being in between 2 sizes in the other styles.
Overall the length & fit around the waist is perfect.  My only issue is how oddly narrow the seaming is on the thigh area. I can bend bit it pulls really tight around just the thighs
This company charged me double and won’t give the money back.  And the pants are the most uncomfortable scrubs I’ve ever worn.  Horrible on all accounts
Very loose around waist area but tight around butt.
Very low waisted Rear-end could have been more generous

I love the look of them but I normally wear a large,so reading the reviews I ordered a medium and had to keep pulling them up all day. So then I ordered a small and they were so tight I was in pain at the end of the day. The medium would have worked okay but it’s elastic band had no string to tighten them.

The color is great. The fit however is lacking. I ordered large as I do with all my scrub pants. This pair is tight in the thighs and hip area. Elastic banding on waistband is too loose and I had to constantly pull them up around my waist. Thankfully they were tight in the hips and thighs or they might’ve fallen off.
Ugh

I wanted to wear them while working around the yard but the fabric is not stretchy enough to move with you to bend in various positions.  The ribbed waistband however is quite comfy.  Too bad the pants just aren't cut right in the hip and thigh and are too tight unless you are very thin and work mostly standing upright.

This is my second pair of this style and brand. I like these pants in general because they fit well on me and fit my lifestyle even though I am not a nurse. I get up before dawn to go to a job that provides a different uniform. The pockets are a big help. I like the no string waistband for a sleeker look under my t-shirt or whatever. They are flattering and comfortable—not too tight or too loose. The colors last with washing. I also wear them for hiking for the same reasons.
